text: Leroy Gordon "Gordo" Cooper Jr. (March 6, 1927 â€“ October 4, 2004) was an American aerospace engineer, test pilot, United States Air Force pilot, and the youngest of the seven original astronauts in Project Mercury, the first human space program of the United States. Cooper died at age 77 from heart failure at his home in Ventura, California, on October 4, 2004. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American astronauts Category:Scientists from Oklahoma
title: Gordon Cooper
